description.short_desc: Actions for working with ListBox objects
Capture Items To a File specified (if not abs, then to test dir)
description.detailed_desc: Capture Items To a File specified (if not abs, then to test dir)

description.short_desc: File name (if not absolute, then to test dir)
description.detailed_desc: File name (if not absolute, then to test dir)

description.short_desc: Specify a character encoding to be used when saving data to a file. If it is not specified, the system default file encoding will be used. The encoding should be a valid string supported by Java; if it is not valid, the system default file encoding will be used instead.
Captures all the items in the list to ...\datapool\test\afile.txt
description.detailed_desc: Captures all the items in the list to ...\datapool\test\afile.txt

description.short_desc: Captures all the items in the list to ...\datapool\test\afile.txt
description.detailed_desc:
Captures all the items in the list to ...\datapool\test\afile.txt
Writing file with "UTF-8" encoding.

description.detailed_desc: Verifies a particular case-sensitive text item is selected

description.short_desc: Case-sensitive text of node that will be verified as selected
description.detailed_desc: TextValue should contain the case-sensitive text of the item expected to already be selected

description.detailed_desc: Verifies a particular case-sensitive text item is NOT selected.

description.short_desc: Case-sensitive text of node that will be verified as unselected

description.detailed_desc: Index of the text item to select, starting from 1

description.short_desc: Selects the first item in the list.
description.detailed_desc: Selects the first item in the list.

description.short_desc: Routine to Click and Verify a selection according to its text value.
description.detailed_desc:
Routine to Click and Verify a selection according to its text value.
Note: RobotJ also uses the identical keyword 'Select'
Note: For RobotJ, there is no additional verify step in the framework code, in other words, for RobotJ, the SelectTextItem and SelectUnverifiedTextItem keywords are identical because RobotJ does all of the verification internally and there is no control over that in it's api.

description.short_desc: Case-sensitive text of node to select and verify.
description.detailed_desc: TextValue should contain the case-sensitive text item to select and verify.

description.short_desc: Selects "AParticularUserID" from the ListBox object.
description.detailed_desc: Selects "AParticularUserID" from the ListBox object and verifies the selection actually occurred.

description.short_desc:
Routine to Click a selection according to its text value.
Note: This keyword triggers the click event
description.detailed_desc:
Routine to Click a selection according to its text value.
NOTE: Only ClickTextItem keyword triggers the click event. SelectTextItem keyword fails to trigger click event on some instances.

description.short_desc: Case-sensitive text of node to select.
description.detailed_desc: TextValue should contain the case-sensitive text item to select.

description.short_desc: Clicks "AParticularUserID" from the ListBox object.
description.detailed_desc: Clicks "AParticularUserID" from the ListBox object.

description.short_desc:
Routine to Right-Click a selection according to its text value.
Note: This keyword triggers the right-click event.
description.detailed_desc: Routine to Right-Click a selection according to its text value.

description.short_desc: Case-sensitive text of node to right-click on.
description.detailed_desc: TextValue should contain the case-sensitive text item to right-click.

description.short_desc: Right-Clicks "AParticularUserID" from the ListBox object.
description.detailed_desc: Right-Clicks "AParticularUserID" from the ListBox object.

description.short_desc: Routine to Control+Click and Verify a selection according to its text value.
description.detailed_desc:
This adds selected items to items already selected.
NOTE: This may not work in all environments (Java, Web, etc...)
For example, in Java, we can usually verify that an item exists in the list; but we do not seem to be able to verify if a newly added selection to multiple selections is actually selected.
So, for Java, we will verify existence in the list, but we cannot verify the selection was successful--we will skip that last check.

description.short_desc: Case-sensitive text of node to select and verify.
Selects "AParticularUserID" from the ListBox object.
description.detailed_desc:
Selects "AParticularUserID" from the ListBox object. This adds to any existing items already selected.
When possible, we will also attempt to verify the added selection was successful.

description.short_desc: Routine to Shift+Click and Verify a selection according to its text value.
description.detailed_desc:
This extends the current selection to include the specified selection and all other items inbetween.
NOTE: This may not work in all environments (Java, Web, etc...)
For example, in Java, we can usually verify that an item exists in the list; but we do not seem to be able to verify if a newly added selection to multiple selections is actually selected.
So, for Java, we will verify existence in the list, but we cannot verify the selection was successful--we will skip that last check.

description.short_desc: Case-sensitive text of node to select and verify.
Selects "AParticularUserID" from the ListBox object.
description.detailed_desc:
Selects "AParticularUserID" from the ListBox object. This adds "AParticularUserID" and any items inbetween to any existing items already selected.
When possible, we will also attempt to verify the added selection was successful.

description.short_desc: Routine to Click a selection according to its text value.
description.detailed_desc:
Routine to Click a selection according to its text value.
No check is performed after the selection to verify success. This is typically done for cases when the listbox is only temporary in nature and disappears immediately upon a selection.
Note: RobotJ also uses the identical keyword 'SelectUnverified'
Note: This is the default for RobotJ, in other words, for RobotJ, the SelectTextItem and SelectUnverifiedTextItem keywords are identical because RobotJ does all of the verification internally and there is no control over that in it's api.

description.short_desc: Case-sensitive text of node to select.
description.detailed_desc:
TextValue should contain the case-sensitive text item to select.
No check is performed after the selection to verify success. This is typically done for cases when the listbox is only temporary in nature and disappears immediately upon a selection.

description.short_desc: Selects "AParticularUserID" from the ListBox object.
description.detailed_desc:
Selects "AParticularUserID" from the ListBox object.
No check is performed after the selection to verify success. This is typically done for cases when the listbox is only temporary in nature and disappears immediately upon a selection.

description.short_desc: Routine to Control+Click an item according to its text value. No post-select verification of the selection is performed.
description.detailed_desc:
Routine to Control+Click an item according to its text value. No post-select verification of the selection is performed. This selection is added to any items already selected.
NOTE: This may not work in all environments (Java, Web, etc...)

description.short_desc: Case-sensitive text of node to select.
Selects "AParticularUserID" from the ListBox object.
description.detailed_desc: Selects "AParticularUserID" from the ListBox. The item is selected and added to the rest of the items already selected.

description.short_desc: Use the identical "SelectAnotherUnverifiedTextItem" instead.
description.detailed_desc:
Routine to Control+Click an item according to its text value. No post-select verification of the selection is performed. This selection is added to any items already selected.
NOTE: This may not work in all environments (Java, Web, etc...)

description.short_desc: Case-sensitive text of node to select.
Selects "AParticularUserID" from the ListBox object.
description.detailed_desc: Selects "AParticularUserID" from the ListBox. The item is selected and added to the rest of the items already selected.

description.detailed_desc: TextValue should contain the case-sensitive text item to DblClick and verify.

description.short_desc: DblClicks "AParticularUserID" in the ListBox object.
description.detailed_desc: Dblclicks "AParticularUserID" in the ListBox object. The current value of the selection is then verified.

description.short_desc: Routine to DblClick an item according to its text value.

No check is performed after the selection to verify success. This is typically done for cases when the listbox is only temporary in nature and disappears immediately upon a selection.

TextValue should contain the case-sensitive text item to DblClick.
No check is performed after the selection to verify success. This is typically done for cases when the listbox is only temporary in nature and disappears immediately upon a selection.

description.short_desc: DblClicks "AParticularUserID" in the ListBox object.

Dblclicks "AParticularUserID" in the ListBox object.
No check is performed after the selection to verify success. This is typically done for cases when the listbox is only temporary in nature and disappears immediately upon a selection.

description.short_desc: Routine to Click and Verify an item according to a partial text match.

Note: for RobotJ, same as SelectUnverifiedPartialMatch

description.short_desc: Clicks the first item containing the substring text in the ListBox.
description.detailed_desc: Clicks the first item containing the substring text in the ListBox. After the selection we verify the item is selected.

description.short_desc: Routine to Click an item according to a partial text match.

Routine to Click an item according to a partial text match.
No check is performed after the selection to verify success. This is typically done for cases when the listbox is only temporary in nature and disappears immediately upon a selection.
Note: for RobotJ, same as SelectPartialMatch

description.short_desc: Case-sensitive substring of node to select.
description.detailed_desc: TextValue should contain the case-sensitive substring to select.

description.short_desc: Clicks the first item containing the substring text in the ListBox.
description.detailed_desc:
Clicks the first item containing the substring text in the ListBox.
No check is performed after the selection to verify success. This is typically done for cases when the listbox is only temporary in nature and disappears immediately upon a selection.

description.short_desc: Routine to DblClick and Verify an item according to a partial text match.
description.detailed_desc: Routine to DblClick and Verify an item according to a partial text match.

description.short_desc: Case-sensitive substring of node to DblClick and verify.
description.detailed_desc: TextValue should contain the case-sensitive substring to DblClick and verify.

description.short_desc: DblClicks the first item containing the substring in the ListBox. The selection is then verified as having occurred.
DblClicks an item according to a partial text match.

detailed_desc.p: DblClicks an item according to a partial text match.
The item is activated but no check is performed after the selection to verify the selection was successful.

description.short_desc: Case-sensitive substring of node to DblClick.
description.detailed_desc: TextValue should contain the case-sensitive substring to DblClick.

description.short_desc: DblClicks the first item containing the substring in the ListBox.

detailed_desc.p: DblClicks the first item containing the substring in the ListBox.
No check is performed after the selection to verify success. This is typically done for cases when the listbox is only temporary in nature and disappears immediately upon a selection.

description.short_desc: Set a variable with the result of checking that a listview contains the provided item.
description.detailed_desc: The search of the item is expected to be a case-sensitive exact match of the item. The provided variable is set with 'TRUE' if the item is found or 'FALSE' if the item is not found.

description.short_desc: The case-sensitive name of the sought item.
description.detailed_desc: ItemText should contain the case-sensitive text item to find in the list view. A message is sent to the log confirming whether or not the item is found in the list view.

description.short_desc: The name of the variable receiving the result.
description.detailed_desc: This variable is set with 'TRUE' if the item is found or 'FALSE' if the item is not found.

short_desc.p: Variable isFound is set to 'TRUE' if the item "AParticularServerName" is found in the ListView object. If the item is not found, the variable isFound is set to 'FALSE'.

description.short_desc: Verifies a particular case-sensitive item is selected based on a substring match.
description.detailed_desc: Verifies a particular case-sensitive item is selected based on a substring match.

description.short_desc: Case-sensitive substring of node that will be verified selected
description.detailed_desc: TextValue should contain the case-sensitive substring of the item expected to already be selected

description.short_desc: Verifies that the first item containing the substring is selected in the ListBox.

description.short_desc: Verifies that the list contains somewhere an item substring "ATextString"
Verifies that the list contains somewhere an item substring "10"
Verifies a particular list-item exists in the list (somewhere)
description.detailed_desc: Verifies a particular list-item exists in the list (somewhere). The comparison can be case-sensitive. By default, it is not.

description.short_desc: String to look for in the list.
description.detailed_desc: String to look for in the list.

description.short_desc: Optional "True" for case-sensitive search
description.detailed_desc:
Optional "True" for case-sensitive search.
Robot (others?) also supports "CASE-SENSITIVE" in place of "TRUE" for this parameter.

description.short_desc: Verifies that the listbox contains somewhere an item equal to "ATextString" using a case-sensitive comparison.

Verifies that the listbox contains somewhere an item equal to "ATextString" using a case-sensitive comparison. The use of "CASE-SENSITIVE" literal text instead of "TRUE" initially is implemented on Robot. Other engines will support this as developers can get in there and add it.
Verifies that the listbox contains somewhere an item equal to "ATextString10" case-insensitive search. The "False" is not really necessary since the search is not case-sensitive by default.
Verifies that the listbox contains somewhere an item equal to "ATextString10" using a comparison that is not case-sensitive.
Verifies a particular list-item does NOT exists in the list (somewhere)
description.detailed_desc: Verifies a particular list-item does NOT exists in the list (somewhere). The comparison can be case-sensitive. It is NOT case-sensitive by default.

description.short_desc: String to look for in the list.
description.detailed_desc: String to look for in the list.

description.short_desc: Optional "True" for case-sensitive search
description.detailed_desc: Optional "True" for case-sensitive search. Robot also supports the literal string "CASE-SENSITIVE" instead of "TRUE".

description.short_desc: Verifies that the listbox does NOT contains somewhere an item equal to "ATextString" case-sensitive search.

Verifies that the listbox does NOT contains somewhere an item equal to "ATextString" case-sensitive search. The "Case-Sensitive" literal text instead of "True" may only be supported by Robot initially.
Verifies that the listbox does NOT contains somewhere an item equal to "ATextString10" case-insensitive search. "False" is not really necessary as comparisons here are NOT case-sensitive by default.
Verifies that the listbox does NOT contains somewhere an item equal to "ATextString10" case-insensitive search.
Verifies a particular list-item substring exists in the list (somewhere)
description.detailed_desc: Verifies a particular list-item substring exists in the list (somewhere). The comparison can be case-sensitive. By default, it is not.

description.short_desc: SubString to look for in the list.
description.detailed_desc: SubString to look for in the list.

description.short_desc: Optional "True" for case-sensitive search
description.detailed_desc:
Optional "True" for case-sensitive search.
Robot (others?) also supports "CASE-SENSITIVE" in place of "TRUE" for this parameter.

description.short_desc: Verifies that the listbox contains somewhere an item containing the substring "Text" using a case-sensitive comparison.

Verifies that the listbox contains somewhere an item containing the substring "Text" using a case-sensitive comparison. The use of "CASE-SENSITIVE" literal text instead of "TRUE" initially is implemented in Robot. Other engines will support this as developers can add it.
Verifies that the listbox contains somewhere an item containing the substring "Text" case-insensitive search. The "False" is not really necessary since the search is not case-sensitive by default.
Verifies that the listbox contains somewhere an item containing the substring "Text" using a comparison that is not case-sensitive.
Verifies a particular list-item substring does NOT exists in the list (somewhere)
description.detailed_desc: Verifies a particular list-item substring does NOT exists in the list (somewhere). The comparison can be case-sensitive. It is NOT case-sensitive by default.

description.short_desc: SubString to look for in the list.
description.detailed_desc: SubString to look for in the list.

description.short_desc: Optional "True" for case-sensitive search
description.detailed_desc: Optional "True" for case-sensitive search. Robot also supports the literal string "CASE-SENSITIVE" instead of "TRUE".

description.short_desc: Verifies that the listbox does NOT contain an item containg the substring "Text" using a case-sensitive search.

Verifies that the listbox does NOT contain an item containing the substring "String" using a case-sensitive search. The "Case-Sensitive" literal text instead of "True" may only be supported by Robot initially.

Verifies that the listbox does NOT contain an item containing the substring "String" using a case-insensitive search. "False" is not really necessary as comparisons here are NOT case-sensitive by default.
Verifies that the listbox does NOT containan item containing the substring "Text" using a case-insensitive search.
